title: About Naoto Kan | The Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant Disaster and the Future of Renewable Energy | Cornell University Press

quotes: Naoto Kan (born October 10, 1946) was prime minister of Japan from June 2010 to September 2011.
Naoto Kan (born October 10, 1946) was prime minister of Japan from June 2010 to September 2011.

He served as health minister under a coalition deal with the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) in the mid-1990s, becoming widely known after he exposed a scandal involving HIV-contaminated blood products.
He played a leading role in the formation of the Democratic Party of Japan (DPJ), which helped sweep the LDP from power in September 2009.
Kan became prime minister after the resignation of fellow Democratic Party member Yukio Hatoyama in 2010.

organizations.name: Tokyo Institute of Technology
quotes: Kan graduated with a degree in physics from the Tokyo Institute of Technology, where he was involved in the student movement, then worked for a patent firm.

organizations.name: Social Democratic Federation
quotes: In 1980, after three unsuccessful attempts, he won a seat in parliament as part of the tiny Social Democratic Federation.
